required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, PK, PD, Immunogenicity and Efficacy of TWP-102 in Patients With Advanced Malignancies.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Phase I, Open Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics, Immunogenicity and Efficacy of TWP-102 in Patients With Advanced Malignancies.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, phase I, open clinical study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, immunogenicity and efficacy of TWP-102 injection in patients with advanced malignancies. This study consists of two parts, including a dose escalation study and a dose expansion study. The criteria for dose escalation will be based on the Bayesian optimal interval (BOIN) design with sequentially enrolled cohorts.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events/serious adverse event related with TWP-102 injection
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 90 days after the last dose
From the first dose of study drug up to 3 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured plasma concentration (Cmax) of TWP-102 injection.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until 90 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of TWP-102 injection.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
From first dose until 90 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected from subjects post treatment for assessment to detect the presence of anti-drug antibodies and neutralizing antibodies.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 2 years

arm_group.description: Four dose levels of TWP-102 injection will be tested by BOIN study design.
Once the effective doses have been determined, two expansion cohorts will be opened to evaluate the efficacy and safety in one or two tumors.
